replies.body:
For the same reason WW ult can miss.  Counterplay.
It does have high execute damage so that's the tradoff.

> [{quoted}](name=LostFr0st,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=8Nap2WzE,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2017-06-01T11:55:59.440+0000)
>
> For the same reason WW ult can miss.  Counterplay.
> It does have high execute damage so that's the tradoff.

It's a point and click ability, not a skill shot. I have 0 control over it hitting.

It locks onto their position and fires from that.  It does feel weird at first when compared to Noc ult, but Rek'sai's scales better.  They'd have to nerf it a lot if they made it lock-on.

If there's a lot of cases where it's not hitting then they'll just adjust the delay (like they did with Kled courage bar proccing).

> [{quoted}](name=LostFr0st,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=8Nap2WzE,comment-id=000000000000,timestamp=2017-06-01T12:06:30.724+0000)
>
> It locks onto their position and fires from that.  It does feel weird at first when compared to Noc ult, but Rek'sai's scales better.  They'd have to nerf it a lot if they made it lock-on.
> 
> If there's a lot of cases where it's not hitting then they'll just adjust the delay (like they did with Kled courage bar proccing).

It's already a bad version of Nocturne ultimate with less than half of Nocturnes range, no utility, AND requires you to damage them and ult them within 5 seconds. It has a bit more scaling than Nocturne, with an execute attached to it, but IMO, as someone with rank 7 Rek'Sai and almost 100k points on her, I'd rather they just GAVE her Nocturne ult than this.

Its been less than a day.
There's no way that even a person with that many points on her can completely adjust to the changes that fast.  Either way, what is written above is still good gut feedback.
Give it a few days and then decide if it still gives you the same feeling.
I have mastery 7 on her, 320k mastery, and have been playing her on the PBE for the past two weeks. Her ult is unreliable shit.
I'll re-iterate: saying "it's unreliable shit" isn't as helpful to them as the explanation Crimpleton added further down.  They won't listen to just saying "it's unreliable shit."

https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/T5yGp9I9-issues-with-reksais-new-ult

I already have a thread
I don't know if Frost is baiting anymore at this point...

The OP explained clearly what their issue was after a couple passes.
That's all I really cared would happen on this thread, and it has.  I'm happy about that.

I just want the "Rek'Sai mains" to say something useful other than:
"Me no like; Rito change now!  Me mad."
They won't change anything very fast if people aren't being objective when communicating.  It's pretty straightforward, and it applies to any champ/game mechanic that bothers people.

"I don't like that Rek'Sai mains know more about that champ than me"

Also they've pointed out, it shouldn't be able to miss given the conditions it already has

Nope, also twisting my words.
To put it a different way, how many patches did it take for them to decrease the time it takes for Skarl to get to Kled?  (6 patches)

I think Rek'Sai has waited too long or this rework already, as I loved playing her on release but then she eventually turned into a knockup bot and I let her go.
If Rek'Sai mains aren't precise in their wording regarding the changes it will take a long while to tweak it.  
Ultimately it's up to you guys how you wanna deal 'em.

Except there's nothing you need to know other than "it shouldn't be able to miss"

It's a click ability, it's not like WW ult, it's not a skillshot. It's not SUPPOSED to miss, it's not intended to. It's a bug that Riot needs to address, an error in the code.

It's NOT a bug.  It is intended that it's miss-able.
That's been stated throughout the Pbe cycle and even earlier today as well:
https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/developer-corner/I2e9uooR-patch-chat-with-the-playtest-team-patch-711?comment=001d000000000001

They have however decided to tighten up the delay after someone asked them explicitly to do so since the counter-play was too easy to access.
God that's even worse, wtf is Riot thinking?

Saying it's unreliable shit is just as prominent as saying "Excuse me fine sirs, but it appears that Rek Sai's ultimate is unable to hit moving targets. Might I suggest making the damage targeted rather than Rek Sai hitbox based?"

It's not.  The tone makes the reader dismiss it as being from someone who won't see reason.
It makes back and forth communication hard, since too many emotions are mixed in.
They'll just end up answering the default "git gud" instead of addressing the issue.

No further communication was needed. Setting up for a conversation is unnecessary.

Additionally, any developer looking for feedback to make development decisions that simply dismisses feedback based on the tone of the text is unfit for the position.

Cause they aren't just readers. They're developers and more than likely have a basic human understanding of common sense enough to deduce "x isn't performing its fucking job" as "x needs to do its job".

> [{quoted}](name=Crimpleton,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=8Nap2WzE,comment-id=0000000000000000,timestamp=2017-06-01T12:10:22.002+0000)

It has a bit more scaling than Nocturne, with an execute attached to it, but IMO, as someone with rank 7 Rek'Sai and almost 100k points on her, I'd rather they just GAVE her Nocturne ult than this.

Nocturne is a old champion which just like 'other OLD champions' NEED SOME MODERNIZATION. That means either they get ultimates that do strong stuff or ultimates that get strong damage, Ultimates may be allowed to have some really big stuff, but if they get to do way too much then they are extremely broken, which in a proper 'balanced world' would mean they'd have to suck some of the power out of the overall kit to get away with how strong they can be.

Reksai's new ultimate works more of a anti-runner measure which means she is going to be pretty useful to chase after champions like 
{{champion:4}} {{champion:3}} {{champion:80}} {{champion:245}} {{champion:98}} and of course, {{champion:56}} when they use their own ultimates more as escape measures instead of what they are 'supposed' to be used as. Especially scummy little {{champion:245}} escapes which i still believe his R still needs some more limits like a 'cap' on how much % health he can recover from the thing so its more like he only recovers up to 30% max health instead of being able to gain a full health bar from 20%~40% to 100% with ease.

{{sticker:slayer-jinx-unamused}} 

Squishie or not, being basically an 'assassin' with a insta full heal button is more ridiculous then a Soraka who can spam her R every 5 seconds.

Unlike Nocture's ult, it has a low cooldown. It feels like forever when you're waiting for your ultimate to come back up on Nocturne. When I played the new Rek'sai, damn thing was up all the time. Sometimes, I even died with it up not even realizing it came off cooldown ages ago. I love that is has such a low cooldown and that alone makes me like it slight more than Noc's ult.

Well Noc's ult darkness effect is also potentially incredibly powerful especially in soloQ with the lack of communication which can make the team fall apart when they lose vision of their allies... so a lot of it's power is there

So you could probably reduce Noc ult cooldown by a lot if you were willing to sacrifice the utility of the global vision denial

I agree that having a point-click ability is bad design: you basically click the enemy and pray it hits, compared to similar types of ults (Warwick, Sion), where you can aim yourself and mitigate the fact that it can miss.

> [{quoted}](name=Acheron16,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=8Nap2WzE,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2017-06-01T12:39:39.257+0000)

it either needs to follow the target like an actual point and click ability, or it needs to be some sort of skillshot that can only target marked enemies.
Thats like asking why can lucian q miss. It just can if done right dont bitch
Lucian Q isn't an ultimate ability.

That's a part of it but the better point is that Lucian's Q is aoe and is also designed to be used as a way to poke in lane by targeting minions and hit multiple people in a teamfight if possible. Rek'Sai's ult is single target and doesn't have any tricks the Rek player can use to hit their target like a Lucian player can.

Rek'sai's entire rework was center around making her more of a bruiser/fighter instead of a tank and her ICONIC ultimate was completely replaced in order to help fulfill that.

on top of that her Ult was given execute damage in order to help Rek'Sai secure kills. This isn't anything at all like Lucians Q. if you aren't making a mole hill out of a mountain comparison then it's an apples to oranges comparison. 

Lucian's Q is a ranged poke/waveclear ability intended to give him resets on his passive. Rek'sai's ULTIMATE is a 1500 range gap closer and execute intended to pick of enemies fleeing combat to finish them off.

It's not just a gap closer. Rek'sai has tunnels AND increased movement speed while burrowed on top of tremor sense to track her target. she doesnt need _just more gap closer_ because there's already plenty in the kit. it's a closing execute and It's a high damage kill securing ability that eats up a considerable amount of her power budget. Which i will confidently say eats MANY times more of her allotted potential than some champions f*cking _Q_ ability.

??????? I'm not sure what you're arguing with me about or what your point is. Though if it's for the reason I think it is then I'll tell you straight out that I was agreeing with Crimpleton that the two abilities are not the same and shouldn't be compared like False 001 did.

Lucian Q was also designed specifically so it sould miss. It isn't a targeted ability in the same way most others are - it's targeted but it fires a skillshot that can miss. New rek'sai ultimate shouldn't be able to miss, you're right.

oh its not just pure targeted? 

well that ability is literally useless. for shame. the champion rework looked so good on paper.

because it has channel time no one is going to stand still while she is ulting. 

hell the jayce didnt even flash or get lantern'd out or anything. what a joke.

Wait a minute...so a champion that had her ultimate completely reworked to be a point-and-click situational finishing move can be dodged completely beyond the user's control to avoid? Normally I would say wait until allies CC, but by the time Rek'Sai takes to the air, the CC will have worn off. This doesn't seem right.

Usually Riot double nerfs things but...

Reduced Range from global range
Can only be used if target was damaged prior to
Can miss target

A triple nerf

Thats some next level shit right there.

The utility of it, being a gap closer should be it's own reward however Rek Sai's CC rely's on her being underground and then popping up under them. This ult doesn't help that, the ult feels inconsistent with the rest of her kit as it is, doesn't really set up anything, it can fail as a damage dealer. I vote for if the ult misses that rek sai lands underground and has her borrow ability refreshed so it can at least be used to travel distances or get to targets. Though personally it shouldn't miss it does have a huge scaling but given the nature of the champion building up to it it's is on risk the ult should be the reward at least.
The real reason as to why it can miss is because everyone will cry and complain about him being to much like a assassin with no counter play yet were blind to how weak assassins are right now.
Her*
Is this a bug? This can't be what they intended.
The way the wiki is worded would mean it's intentional, but then again anyone can edit the wiki. I HOPE it isn't intentional.

I do too. There's no reason for it to be THAT inconsistent. It's a single target point and click ability. It shouldn't be able to miss unless your target goes invulnerable, or dies before you reach them.

To those claiming it is a bug, I'm afraid to say that I don't think it is. While on a much smaller scale, and more difficult to recreate, Fizz's Q can miss as well if the champ moves/teleports fast enough.
or flashes. Fizzes q is specifically coded to miss if the target leaves q range then the q misses.
